API documentation¶

Class hierarchy¶

A schematic overview of the class hierarchy is seen in the diagram below:

As the classes will be of primary interest for future extensions, all are documented hereafter.

API¶

class color_space_converter.ColorSpaceConverter(*args, **kwargs)¶
__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

The converter baseclass provides a scheme of variables and functions that all child converter classes have in common. The child classes are thought to handle the conversion specific to a certain color space.

Parameters

  • args – passed arguments are assigned to variables in the following order: 1) src image 2) conversion method 3) inverse option 4) standard option

  • kwargs – supported keyword arguments are as follows: ‘src’, ‘method’, ‘inverse’ and ‘standard’

main(img: numpy.ndarray = None, method: str = None, inverse: str = False, standard: str = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

The main function and high-level entry point performing the color space conversion. Valid methods are

Parameters

  • img (ndarray) – input array in either RGB or xyz color space

  • method (str) – describing target color space

  • inverse (boolean) – option that determines whether conversion is from rgb2yuv (False) or yuv2rgb (True)

  • standard (string) – option that determines whether head- and footroom are excluded (‘HDTV’) or considered otherwise

Returns

Resulting image after color mapping

Return type

np.ndarray

gry_conv(img: numpy.ndarray = None, inverse: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray¶

Convert RGB color space to monochromatic color space or to 3-channel array given the inverse option.

Parameters

  • img (ndarray) – input array in either RGB or monochromatic color space

  • inverse (boolean) – option that determines whether conversion is from rgb2gry (False) or gry2ch3 (True)

Returns

color space converted array

Return type

ndarray

class color_space_converter.XyzConverter(*args, **kwargs)¶

xyz_conv(img: numpy.ndarray = None, inverse: bool = False, standard: str = 'Adobe', norm: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray¶

Convert RGB color space to xyz color space or vice versa given the inverse option.

Parameters

  • img (ndarray) – input array in either RGB or xyz color space

  • inverse (boolean) – option that determines whether conversion is from rgb2xyz (False) or xyz2rgb (True)

  • standard (str, optional) – option that determines which standard (Adobe or ITU) is used

  • norm (bool, optional) – option that determines whether matrix is normalized to allow for R=G=B=1 to X=Y=Z=1 mappings

Returns

color space converted array

Return type

ndarray

validate_color_chs() → bool¶

This function checks whether provided images consist of 3 color channels. An exception is thrown otherwise.

validate_img_dims() → bool¶

This function validates the image dimensions. It throws an exception if the dimension are unequal to 2 or 3.

validate_types() → bool¶

This function analyzes the variable type from supported keywords ‘src’, ‘method’, ‘inverse’ and ‘standard’. An exception is thrown if the data types are not as expected.

property arr¶

getter for array that is color converted
